page.title: 01THE WEST END,DUNDEE
page.content: The West End of Dundee is an area of contrasts: to the south, along the river, there is a ribbon of exclusive stone-built housing which changes, closer to the city centre, into a mixture of tenement property and factories. To the north-west, there is the modern housing development of Menzieshill. Much of the older, decaying property, both industrial and domestic, is being rehabilitated: many of the huge, monolithic mill areas are being transformed into small factory units and modern housing, as houses are again being given priority near the city centre. The area also contains 3 colleges, the University, and 4 hospitals. There is also a lot of open space: Riverside airport, several parks and the Law, which dominates the skyline.
